page.title: 03Outdoor Education Centre
page.content: Fairplay House was built in 1928 by the Labour Peer Lord Braintree. When he died in the mid 1950's the house was sold to the London Borough of East Ham and converted into an old people's home. At this time the name was changed from Crockies to Fairplay House as being more suitable. When the railway was abandoned in 1963 there was no adequate transport link with East London and it was taken over by the Education Department.The Centre now provides short-term residential courses in various aspects of outdoor education for the London Borough of Newham's schools, colleges, youth organisations, teachers and leaders. The courses include environmental studies, sailing, canoeing, orienteering, walking and camping expeditions.
